update.description:
consolidate GetWallTime() calls

fixed "Time divide by zero" warnings when starting gazebo.

fixed throttle with offsets and clock latency.

made clock resolution parameter static, checked during construction of Time class.
update.title: new Time::NSleep() call.  Sleep will check to see if timer resolution is smaller than the requested sleep, and skip sleep if otherwise.  This should solve the problem where system with scpi disabled using large clock resolutions are not able to run faster

content.raw: I tried it a bit, but then had a hard time figuring out which one was causing drift from desired time throttle rate...  I figure it might be ok as long as we can achieve exactly 1X real-time when asked, even with a little overhead?  The test case I have been using is DRC at real-time with 1ms physics step size.  I'll play around with it some more.
content.html: I tried it a bit, but then had a hard time figuring out which one was causing drift from desired time throttle rate... I figure it might be ok as long as we can achieve exactly 1X real-time when asked, even with a little overhead? The test case I have been using is DRC at real-time with 1ms physics step size. I'll play around with it some more.

content.raw: actual sleep time for a 1nanosecond sleep request on my desktop is about 60 usec, taking this offset into account, we can get truly the rate the user is asking for.
